artist: James Rosenquist; Printer: Hollander Workshop, New York; Publisher: Castelli Graphics, New York, and Hollanders Workshop, New York
image_copyright: © James Rosenquist / Licensed by VAGA at Artists Rights Society (ARS), NY
markings: Publisher's blindstamp, LRC of right-hand sheet: Hollanders Workshop
provenance: Dayton Hudson Corporation/Target Corporation, Minneapolis, May 1972-2001; given to MIA.
signed: Signed and dated in pencil, LRC of right-hand sheet: James Rosenquist 1969
text: Pop artist James Rosenquist was strongly influenced by the large scale, bright colors, and simple forms of outdoor billboard advertising, an industry he once worked as an installer. In this early editioned lithograph, Rosenquist depicts a severed telephone cable, a subject that apparently fascinated him and may have served as a metaphor for the breakdown of communication. When he was asked about his billboard-inspred work, Rosenquist replied that his intention is …to get as far away from nature as possible.
title: Area Code
